{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3328977,"name":"WarrenR","username":"warren.reynolds1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/a8b319/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-10T12:31:28.979Z","cooked":"

C++
We are trying to implement PathPlanners pathFindToPose feature using the autobuilder option.

We can get it to work with a hard coded pose thanks to the path planner docs (NB: @mjansen4857, there is a typo in the docs. The angular acceleration units are listed as 720_deg_per_s when they need to be per second squared 720_deg_per_s_sq) but we are having trouble trying to implement it to work with a Pose that is calculated at runtime from inside the Drive Subsystem Periodic. Eg The Pose of a note detected on the floor in front of the robot.

This is what we have tried.
We have a method in our drivesubsyem that returns a frc2::CommandPtr that is made from AutoBuilder::pathFindToPose. And we have a method is the drive subsytem called getNotePose() that returns a Pose2d of the detected note.

frc2::CommandPtr DriveSubsystem::PathfindToNote(){
    return AutoBuilder::pathfindToPose([this] {return this->getNotePose();},
                pathplanner::PathConstraints{0.5_mps, 1.0_mps_sq,540_deg_per_s, 720_deg_per_s_sq});
  }

We tried to put a Lambda that returns a pose2D where it wants a pose, but this doesn’t compile with a warning of
no suitable user-defined conversion from "lambda []()->frc::Pose2d" to "frc::Pose2d" existsC/C++(312)
I assume the issues are because the command is made as the code is starting up, as the robot container is being created and an instance of our command is being created and put on the dashboard.

We also tried to do it, the same way as the autonomous command is created at run time with
std::optional <frc2::CommandPtr> m_DriveToNote;
as a member variable in our drive subsystem.
But couldn’t get this to work either.
Has anyone got some lines of C++ code that achieve what we are trying to do or is this impossible because of the declarative nature of Command Based Coding?
Thanks in advance
Warren

Yes, it’s possible, you can wrap the command retrieved by the pathfindToPose command inside a DeferredCommand(It’s a WPILib command).

DeferredCommand receives a supplier of a command and when initialized it gets the command from the supplier and runs it.

Not sure about the implementation in C++ but it should work.

Thanks.
Unfortunately documentation and example code showing the use of the DeferredCommand is pretty light on.

Does anyone know how to convert a commandPtr to a wpi::unique_function<CommandPtr()> or has anyone used a DeferredCommand with CommandPtr style commands in C++
